title: Official entrance age to pre-primary education
subtitle:
Age at which students would enter pre-primary education assuming they progress through pre-primary education for its entire official duration and start at the official entrance age for primary education. The official primary entry age, in turn, is the age at which children are obliged to start primary education
according to national legislation or policies. Where more than one age is specified, for example, in different parts of a country, UNESCO stipulates the use the most common official entry age (i.e. the age at which most children in the country are expected to start primary).
